warning: Be careful with phenol:chloroform and chloroform; wear appropriate PPE.
manuscript_citation: Lippmeier JC, Crawford KS, Owen CB, Rivas AA, Metz JG, et al. (2009) Characterization of both polyunsaturated fatty acid biosynthetic pathways in Schizochytrium sp. Lipids 44: 621-630.

groups.group_name: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data:
Prepare extraction buffer:

20 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0

50 mM NaCl

10 mM EDTA

0.5% SDS

 

Also need stocks of

proteinase K (10 mg per ml is handy) 

RNAse A (25 mg per ml is handy)

phenol:chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (25:24:1)

chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (24:1)

3M NaOAc (sodium acetate)

100% ethanol

70% ethanol

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 1 of Labyrinthulomycete DNA extraction protocol
source_data.annotation:
This protocol has worked well for Aurantiochytrium limacinum ATCC1381 and Aplanochytrium kerguelense PBS07, meaning that it produced clean spools of genomic DNA.

For Aurantiochytrium, a 50 ml culture in medium 790BY+, 2 or 3 days old, yields ~350-400 mg wet biomass and ~200-300 ug DNA. 

This protocol has never worked as well for Schizochytrium aggregatum ATCC28209; the DNA comes out more fragmented and in a background of a small precipitate and had to be collected by centrifugation rather than spooling. (sometimes this happens with the other strains, too) I was able to a cleaner prep by redissolving the initial pellet and performing a LiCl precipitation (final concentration 2M LiCl, incubated at -20C for 1 hour, then centrifuged at 16,000 xg and 4C for 20 minutes) then adding 1 volume isopropanol to the supernatant, which produced a nice spool of DNA (but get it out quickly).

For Aurantiochytrium, a 50 ml culture in medium 790BY+, 2 or 3 days old, yields ~350-400 mg wet biomass and ~200-300 ug DNA. 

This protocol has never worked as well for Schizochytrium aggregatum ATCC28209; the DNA comes out more fragmented and in a background of a small precipitate and had to be collected by centrifugation rather than spooling. (sometimes this happens with the other strains, too) I was able to a cleaner prep by redissolving the initial pellet and performing a LiCl precipitation (final concentration 2M LiCl, incubated at -20C for 1 hour, then centrifuged at 16,000 xg and 4C for 20 minutes) then adding 1 volume isopropanol to the supernatant, which produced a nice spool of DNA (but get it out quickly).
source_data.body:
This protocol has worked well for Aurantiochytrium limacinum ATCC1381 and Aplanochytrium kerguelense PBS07, meaning that it produced clean spools of genomic DNA.

For Aurantiochytrium, a 50 ml culture in medium 790BY+, 2 or 3 days old, yields ~350-400 mg wet biomass and ~200-300 ug DNA. 

This protocol has never worked as well for Schizochytrium aggregatum ATCC28209; the DNA comes out more fragmented and in a background of a small precipitate and had to be collected by centrifugation rather than spooling. (sometimes this happens with the other strains, too) I was able to a cleaner prep by redissolving the initial pellet and performing a LiCl precipitation (final concentration 2M LiCl, incubated at -20C for 1 hour, then centrifuged at 16,000 xg and 4C for 20 minutes) then adding 1 volume isopropanol to the supernatant, which produced a nice spool of DNA (but get it out quickly).

components.data:
Resuspend ~100 mg wet weight fresh cell pellet in 1 ml extraction buffer plus 100 ug per ml proteinase K

Incubate at 45 minutes at 50C

 

(can spin down cells from liquid culture, or washed from agar plate, at 4000xg (in C0650 rotor), room temp, 10 minutes; wash in 50% artifical seawater then ddwater before a final spin and weighing pellet)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Resuspend ~100 mg wet weight fresh cell pellet in 1 ml extraction buffer plus 100 ug per ml proteinase K

Incubate at 45 minutes at 50C

 

(can spin down cells from liquid culture, or washed from agar plate, at 4000xg (in C0650 rotor), room temp, 10 minutes; wash in 50% artifical seawater then ddwater before a final spin and weighing pellet)

components.data:
Add 100 ug per ml RNAse A

Incubate for 15 minutes at 37C
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add 100 ug per ml RNAse A

Incubate for 15 minutes at 37C

components.data:
Extract with an equal volume of phenol:chloroform:isoamyl alcohol

Mixing gently for 30 minutes at room temperature

Gently centrifuge (~8,000 x g, 10 minutes) to separate phases

Transfer aqueous phase to a fresh tube 

REPEAT
components.name: Description

components.data:
Extract with an equal volume of chloroform:isoamyl alcohol

Mixing gently for ~5 minutes at room temperature

Gently centrifuge (~8,000 x g, 10 minutes) to separate phases if needed

Transfer aqueous phase to a fresh tube 

REPEAT
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

Mixing gently for ~5 minutes at room temperature

Gently centrifuge (~8,000 x g, 10 minutes) to separate phases if needed

REPEAT

components.data:
Add 0.1 volume 3 M NaOAc

Add 2 volumes ice-cold 100% ethanol

DNA should precipitate as a fluffy ball; collect by spooling onto a glass rod

(a Pasteur pipette with the open end melted closed works well)

Wash by dipping in 70% ethanol

Air dry

Dissolve in ~100-350 microliters water or TE (pH 8.0)

(depending how much biomass went in)
